intro: Anerincleistus rudis, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
